p: Increased virulence of CDV for some species may have occurred due to mutations in the P and other genes. On some occasions Rockborn-based vaccines may have reverted and caused disease in domestic dogs and wildlife. The potential for CDV and PDV to infect humans may require few amino acid changes. Prevention of the spread of such a zoonotic virus in the human population will only be held in check by maintaining high herd immunity to MV.
